criterion: Provides a clear and organized SOAP note
Includes a relevant chief complaint and history of present illness
Includes a relevant physical exam and vital signs
Provides an accurate diagnosis or suspected diagnosis based on the patient's symptoms and medical history
Falsely assumes a specific diagnosis without considering alternative explanations
Asks relevant follow-up questions to clarify the patient's symptoms and medical history
Uses technical jargon or overly complex language that may be difficult for a non-medical professional to understand
Provides clear and concise instructions for the patient to follow
Follows the patient's instructions and clarifies any unclear information
Fails to address the patient's concerns or questions
